data.message:
[SW-2822] Rename repository to synchros2 (#180)

## Proposed changes

<!-- 
    A brief description of the changes you are making. 
    Make sure to refer to the issue that explains and
    motivates this patch.
-->

This patch replaces all references to the `ros_utilities` repository with references to the `synchros2` repository, following repository rename to comply with [REP-144](https://www.ros.org/reps/rep-0144.html).

### Checklist

<!-- Mark each checkbox as you make progress in your contribution. -->

- [x] I have added tests that prove my changes are effective

data.author: Jenny Barry
data.message:
Move synchros2 tutorials to their own package and create custom message (#164)

## Proposed changes

This creates `synchros2_tutorials` and `synchros2_tutorials_interfaces` packages as examples in `ros_utilities`.  Since I didn't want people to have package conflict after creating their own versions I named the ones here with `_example`.

Additionally, I updated the tutorials to use a custom string message instead of `std_msgs/String`.  `std_msgs/String` is deprecated and we'll need the interfaces package for the action tutorial.  However it does add a bit of complexity to `GettingStartedGuide` so I'm open to using the example messages string instead.

### Checklist

<!-- Mark each checkbox as you make progress in your contribution. -->

- [x] Lint and unit tests pass locally
- [x] I have added tests that prove my changes are effective
- [x] I have added necessary documentation to communicate the changes

### Additional comments

<!-- Anything else worth mentioning. -->

data.author: mhidalgo-bdai
data.message:
[N/A] Update mypy version (#170)

## Proposed changes

<!-- 
    A brief description of the changes you are making. 
    Make sure to refer to the issue that explains and
    motivates this patch.
-->
We recently started having issues with `mypy`. It turns out we've been running off a very old version. This updates the pre-commit hook version to 1.16.0 (the last one that still supports Python 3.8) in hopes that resolves CI failures.

### Checklist

<!-- Mark each checkbox as you make progress in your contribution. -->

- [x] Lint and unit tests pass locally
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my changes are effective
- [ ] I have added necessary documentation to communicate the changes

data.author: mhidalgo-bdai
data.message:
[EK-70] Support callbacks in ActionFuture (#168)

## Proposed changes

<!-- 
    A brief description of the changes you are making. 
    Make sure to refer to the issue that explains and
    motivates this patch.
-->

This patch introduces `synchros2.action.ActionFuture.add_done_callback()` and `synchros2.action.ActionFuture.add_feedback_callback()` APIs for a less future-like approach to asynchronous actions.

data.author: mhidalgo-bdai
data.message:
[SW-2822] Make synchros2 rosdoc2 compliant (#166)

## Proposed changes

<!-- 
    A brief description of the changes you are making. 
    Make sure to refer to the issue that explains and
    motivates this patch.
-->
Picking up from where we left off in https://github.com/bdaiinstitute/ros_utilities/pull/133. This patch makes `synchros2` compliant with `rosdoc2` for documentation generation and lays the ground for tutorials and guides.

![synchros2_docs.png](https://app.graphite.dev/user-attachments/assets/15e8872e-9e2b-485d-922d-c369e2089aa2.png)

### Checklist

<!-- Mark each checkbox as you make progress in your contribution. -->

- [ ] I have added tests that prove my changes are effective
- [x] I have added necessary documentation to communicate the changes

data.message:
[SW-1712] Pin ubuntu version in workflows (#137)

## Change Overview

This is simply a find/replace of `ubuntu-latest` -> `ubuntu-22.04`.  Because `ubuntu-latest` will become 24.04 soon.  We should pin to 22.04 which matches our development environment.

## Testing Done

None. This PR is the test.  (Assuming this repo has CI)

data.author: mhidalgo-bdai
data.message:
Add thread-safe message filters (#110)

Follow-up to #109. It turns out that upstream `message_filters` are not quite safe to use in multi-threaded applications (at least in Python). This patch introduces thread-safe equivalents that are API compatible with upstream ones.
